title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 23 June 2017 - BBC News
summary: mp says more midwives needed to cope with rural births .
man guilty of child sex offences sentenced to 16 years in prison .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: a dry , bright day with some sunny intervals and highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: i and the team will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18:00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: watch : the big reveal for matthew cooper
text: the bbc 's diy sos were called in to transform the cooper family home in trench so 12-year-old matthew could return home .
he had been in hospital for over a year fighting a brain tumour .
this was the moment he finally got to go home .
if you missed the really touching episode , you can watch in full on bbc iplayer .

documents.title: future of midwifery in shropshire is a 'challenge ' says mp
text: health minister and mp for ludlow , philip dunne , says no decision has been made on the future of rural maternity services but a review is ongoing .
midwife-led units in ludlow , oswestry and bridgnorth have suffered a string of closures due to staff sickness .
in 2016-17 , 85 % of shropshire babies were born at the consultant-led unit at telford 's princess royal hospital and just 36 babies were born at ludlow 's mlu .
but mr dunne says it 's important women retain the choice of where they give birth .
i 'm very keen because of the distance and the geography to ensure that mothers can continue to have babies born safely in the rural market towns . ''

documents.title: replacement bus service to start this weekend
text: some changes to the rail network to be aware of from this weekend and every weekend until sunday 16 july .
replacement bus services will operate on the route between hereford and shrewsbury due to engineering works .
due to essential engineering work , rail replacement services will run between hereford & shrewsbury until 16 july .
check before travel

documents.title: watch : your weekend weather forecast
text: after a mainly cloudy day , here 's what 's in store for the start of this weekend across the west midlands .
you can stay updated over the next couple of days through the bbc weather website .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man guilty of child sex offences
text: a man has been sentenced to 16 years in prison after being found guilty of a string of child sex offences .

james heywood , 69 , of bader close in apley , was found guilty of three counts of rape , three counts of indecent assault , one count of indecent assault against a child under 13 and a number of other charges at shrewsbury crown court .
the offences took place between 1989 and 2016 and involved three girls aged between 11 and 15 at the time of the offences , police said .
heywood was found not guilty of one count of causing sexual activity with a child , one count of rape and one count of indecent assault .

documents.title: postmen drop thousands of rubber bands says resident
text: telford 's postmen have been criticised for dropping rubber bands .
a woodside resident says he 's collected more than 2,000 of them in the last six months .
the royal mail says they 're biodegradable and break down in 12 months .
but david who lives on warrens way says it 's littering and he plans to give the rubber bands back to royal mail for christmas .

documents.title: whitchurch gp 'super surgery ' could be built by 2019
text: a new gp `` super surgery '' for thousands of patients in north shropshire could be built by 2019 .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: andes fall tourist 's poems published
text: andes fall tourist 's poems published

documents.title: tns pitch undergoes test ahead of champions league
text: tns have a big match on tuesday night , so the pitch at park hall is getting a good looking over .
the welsh premier league champions face gibraltar side europa fc over two legs in the first qualifying round of the champions league .
the return leg will be played on 4 july in portugal .
the pitch at park hall is being tested ahead of tuesday 's champions league game !

documents.title: health minister wants more midwives in shropshire
text: philip dunne , mp for ludlow and also a minister at the department of health , says he wants to see more midwives recruited in the county .
it comes after a string of closures of maternity units in ludlow , bridgnorth and oswestry due to staff sickness .
mr dunne has spoken to the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust ( sath ) and says they are intending to recruit more staff .

it will take time and that 's why they 're working with the ccg [ clinical commissioning group ] to come up with a plan for the coming weeks so that there is not this constant stop-start service , which is very unsettling . ''

documents.title: poetry written by shropshire man who died in peru is published
text: a shropshire man has published a book of his son 's poems to commemorate him a year after his death .
harry greaves was killed in a fall whilst trekking in peru .
his father simon , from bronygarth near oswestry , has published the book in his memory .
he says he did n't realise harry was writing poetry and he was pleased to discover them and be able to put them into print .
we published all the poems of his that we could find .
there are 23 in the book .
we wanted it to be a celebration of his life . ''

documents.title: football : new signings for the bucks
text: afc telford united have made two signings .
defender ross white joins from southport and winger elliott newby has left barrow to link up with the bucks .
white is a full-back who has played most of his career at wrexham .
twenty one-year-old newby spent parts of last season on loan at altrincham , in the national north league .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford driver admits causing crash which killed oap
text: a driver has pleaded guilty to causing the death by careless driving of a pensioner who suffered a head injury in a two-car crash .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town back in training
text: shrewsbury town players report back for training today after a shortened summer break of seven weeks .
town 's manager paul hurst says that 's quite enough - ahead of getting everyone up to speed for the first game of the new season on 5 august against northampton town .
friday we come back in , so we 'll work friday and saturday morning .
quite a bit of that will be testing and then we 'll get into the really tough work . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: mp seeks to reassure after maternity closures
text: ludlow 's mp philip dunne says he 's confident maternity services in the county can get back on to a `` stable footing '' following a series of critical reports , staff shortages and a string of closures at units in ludlow , bridnorth and oswestry .

the number of baby deaths in the county is higher than it should be according to the royal college of obstetricians and gynaecologists and the rural units keep having to be closed because of staff sickness .

mr dunne , who 's also a minister of the department of health , says the two issues are linked - but says he 's been assured that the shrewsbury and telford hospitals trust is working hard to recruit more midwives .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: diy sos : your comments
text: the true community spirit of telford was on display for all to see last night .
one 's diy sos visited the cooper family earlier this year and their work was broadcast last night .
it certainly got an emotional response on social media .

documents.title: weather watchers : dark skies over shropshire
text: thanks to weather watcher peter steggles for these snaps of longnor .
it 's looking a bit grim out there .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: minister visits shropshire prison
text: the home office minister sam gyimah has been to visit the work being done at hmp stoke heath near market drayton .
during a meeting yesterday he spoke to governor john huntington about the challenges the prison faces and what the government is doing to recruit more prison officers .
the prison is installing a car mechanics workshop to train inmates and give them a better chance of employment on release .
it 's also approaching shropshire businesses about any job opportunities for ex-prisoners to help them rebuild their lives .

documents.title: call for action at 'death trap ' junction
text: action is being demanded to improve safety at a road junction between ludlow and tenbury that has been described as a death trap .
author: Droitwich Spa Advertiser

documents.title: diy sos : 'you 've brought him home '
text: telford took pride of place on bbc one for diy sos last night .
the episode , that was filmed in trench earlier in the year , showed the work and community effort that went into transforming the home of 12-year-old matthew cooper .
he spent more than a year in hospital fighting a brain tumour - but before he could return home his house needed major work .
here 's the moment his parents were finally able to bring him home .
if you missed the really touching episode , you can watch in full on bbc iplayer .

documents.title: machine vs maize . a global robot battle
text: machine vs maize . a global robot battle
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: robot wars on the farm
text: robots from across the world have been battling against each other in a competition at harper adams university in shropshire .
they 've been carrying out farming tasks from identifying weeds to spraying .
the organisers say one day programming a robot will be as familiar as maintaining a tractor .
researchers at harper adams are themselves trying to sow , look after and then harvest a field of barley using only robots and antonymous vehicles .
no humans are allowed into the pilot-plot at all .
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: chirk bypass road repair hold-ups linked to terror attacks
text: repairs to a road bridge have been held up because resources are being used in terrorist prevention .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: thomas parker - the electric pioneer
text: a century before the term eco-friendly became popular , one man was commuting to work in an electric car .
born in ironbridge , the birthplace of the industrial revolution , thomas parker built his electric vehicle in wolverhampton in 1884 .
the victorian pioneer even designed a steam-powered generator to recharge it .
perhaps most amazingly , parker built his electric car 10 years before the first petrol car in britain .
invented in the midlands can be seen on friday , 23 june at 19:30 on bbc one and afterwards on the bbc iplayer .

documents.title: court appearances over prison drone drugs plot
text: a group of people are due to appear in court today charged with conspiring to use drones to fly drugs , weapons and other banned items into jails , including stoke heath in shropshire .
two women and seven men are also accused of throwing items over prison walls .

documents.title: video : what 's the weather doing today ?
text: a cloudy and breezy day with some bright intervals but the possibility of some showers too with top temperatures of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : tower block safety and brexit anniversary
text: on midlands today this evening , we 'll be looking at how safe tower blocks are in the region following the grenfell tower fire - and new plans from some of our councils .
plus , a year on from the brexit vote , we 'll be hearing how opinions have moved on in the midlands since that decisive day .
join us for those stories and more from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shropshire university rated 'gold ' under new ranking system
text: harper adams university in shropshire has been rated gold under a new ranking of degree teaching standards .
the teaching excellence framework ( tef ) has rated 295 institutions bronze , silver or gold according to their standard of undergraduate teaching .
gold went to harper adams and 58 others , with silver going to 116 .
a gold award means a university is of the highest quality found in the uk , providing `` consistently outstanding teaching , learning and outcomes for its students '' .
author: Katherine Sellgren
BBC News education reporter

documents.title: festivals dominated by male acts , study shows
text: music festivals fail to reflect the diversity of the uk music scene , with headline slots being dominated by a small band of male rock acts over the decades , a study suggests .
some eight out of 10 top slots were occupied by all-male acts , analysis of more than 600 headline appearances across 14 major festivals found .
the v festival at weston park is an honourable exception .
born in the midst of britpop , it 's re-positioned itself as a festival for pop connoisseurs , booking acts like calvin harris , beyonce , rudimental , olly murs and pink as headliners .
it 's proof that audiences will embrace diversity - in gender , in genre and in the race of their artists - if they 're given the chance .
author: Peter Sherlock
BBC Data unit

documents.title: weather : much cooler today and into the weekend
text: it 's felt much fresher today , with highs of 22c ( 72f ) .
and it 's going to stay that way for the next few days .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police search for man after violent incident in telford
text: police are searching for a man in connection with a violent incident in telford .
police said they had been unable to trace 20-year-old shaquil sultan , from wellington following an incident in ketley on 14 june .
three other men , aged between 21 and 33 , have been charged with a series of offences including fighting , dangerous driving , criminal damage and possession of an offensive weapon .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the big reveal on diy sos tonight
text: the transformation of a house in telford will feature on diy sos on bbc one this evening .
twelve-year-old matthew cooper spent more than a year in hospital fighting a brain tumour - but before he could return home his house needed major work .
the local community got the tv show on board .
the episode is on bbc one at 21:00 .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 10k race organiser 'followed protocol '
text: the organiser of a 10k road race being held in ludlow next month says he 's followed all of the correct procedures in applying for roads in the town centre to be shut , while the race is on .

some residents who live on the route are angry that shropshire and ludlow town council , did n't consult them about the road closures and that it 's taking place on a saturday evening , rather than a sunday morning .
but organiser dermot heyes says when they did their research they concluded that saturday night was the best option .
we spoke , early in february , to the town council .
we spoke with shropshire highways and we did not announce the race until we were absolutely sure that we had the go ahead from the town council . ''
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: row in ludlow over 10k plans
text: ludlow 's choral society is voicing its concerns about the town 's 10k road race next month .

the night-time run , due to take place on saturday 8 july between 18:00 to 22:00 , clashes with the society 's summer concert and people wo n't be able to get to st lawrence 's church because of the road closures .
organisers say it 'll bring a welcome economic boost for the town , but some local people are angry and say that they ca n't drive anywhere while the race is on and that there was no consultation .
mill street is totally closed to residents and we have no alternative access in or out of the street during this event . ''
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: vigil to be held in wellington after london mosque attack
text: a vigil 's being staged in wellington this evening after the attack on worshippers at a mosque in north london .
telford stand up to racism are gathering from 18:30 by the peace garden at the civic centre .
detectives are still trying to work out the cause of a man 's death at the mosque in finsbury park .
a van was driven at worshippers , some of whom were giving makram ali first aid after he 'd fallen ill .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: olivia-violet reeves : inquest opens into 11-year-old shrewsbury girl
text: the inquest into the death of an 11-year-old shrewsbury schoolgirl olivia-violet reeves was today opened and adjourned .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: seasonal worker issue not a new problem says county mp
text: former environment secretary and north shropshire mp owen paterson says the issue of getting enough seasonal workers to uk farms has always been an issue .
a bbc survey has found that british salad and fruit producers are having trouble recruiting more than half say they do n't know if they 'll have enough migrant workers to harvest their crops .
many growers blame the weak pound and uncertainty over brexit .
there 's no doubt we do need to have a scheme which can bring in targeted skilled workers whether they are fruit or eye surgeons . ''

documents.title: shropshire 's out of hours gp service spending more than it earns
text: increased workloads and a rise in the number of patients are contributing to shropdoc spending more than it 's earning .
shropshire 's out of hours gp service , recently named as one of the best in the country , is having to consider redundancies to save money .
its chairman dr russell muirhead , says the changes wo n't affect patient services though .
the potential redundancies are not in services which patients access .
so the front line , the call handlers , the clinicians , the drivers etc .
those roles are not part of this cutback that we 're looking at at the moment . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tangled woodpecker released back into wild
text: a woodpecker that was trapped in discarded fishing line over a wolverhampton canal is due to be released back into the wild by the rspca today .
you can see its predicament here
the bird was treated at a rescue centre in shropshire after a barbed hook got stuck in its wing .
fran hill , from the rescue centre , said the woodpecker arrived `` incredibly stressed '' after the ordeal and said it had been `` very , very lucky '' .
the rspca will take the woodpecker back to the canal where it was found later today , with the release to be followed by bbc midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .

documents.title: farmers warn of acute staff shortages after brexit
text: fruit and vegetable growers in the midlands are warning that uncertainty over brexit will lead to a shortage of seasonal workers .
it 's thought 80,000 are needed in the uk annually - the majority come from eastern europe .
many growers blame the weak pound which has reduced their workers ' earning power , as well as uncertainty over brexit , according to a bbc survey .
author: Emma Simpson
Business correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: watch : shropshire company boss on brexit worries
text: it 's almost a year since britain voted to leave the european union , and formal brexit negotiations began this week .
one hundred people work at salop design and engineering in shrewsbury , making parts for the motor industry - 15 % of goods made there are exported to germany and usa .
boss chris greenough says many firms are concerned about how brexit will affect business .
author: Joanne Writtle
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: 'vicious ' telford rapist 's 10-year prison sentence is upheld
text: a vicious sex attacker from telford who attacked a vulnerable teenager with a bottle and repeatedly raped her has had his 10-year prison sentence backed by top judges .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : full fixture list for shrewsbury town
text: here 's everything you need to know ahead of the new league one season .
the opening game of the season for shrewsbury is at home to northampton on 5 august .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: parents told 'baby would likely have been born alive '
text: there had been no hint of anything being wrong when katie wilkins went to hospital in february 2013 .
the labour ward was full so katie and her partner dave jackson were put into a side room .
staff refused the family 's request for katie 's waters to be broken in the side room , saying there was a risk of infection .
when katie was checked a few days later , staff realised her baby maddison had died .
a letter to the parents in july 2013 said `` maddison would likely have been born alive '' if she had been induced sooner .
author: Michael Buchanan
Social Affairs Correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: ninth avoidable baby death at shropshire 's main hospital trust
text: news has uncovered a ninth avoidable death at the shrewsbury and telford nhs hospital nhs trust .
maddison dawn wilkins jackson died in 2013 after staff at the royal shrewsbury hospital could not find her mother a bed on the labour ward .
the trust says it has apologised to maddison 's family for her death and introduced key changes .
maddison 's death is at least the ninth avoidable death at the shrewsbury and telford trust since 2013 .
seven of the babies died in a 20-month period between september 2014 and may 2016 .
an inquiry has been launched by the health secretary .
following maddison 's death we made changes to our practices which have included improving advice for midwives around foetal movement and monitoring in line with national nice guidelines . ''

documents.title: diy sos transform home of boy with brain tumour
text: a diy sos project to transform the home of a telford boy living with a brain tumour is to air on bbc one tonight .
more than 200 volunteers from across the area came together in march to adapt the home of 12-year-old matthew cooper in trench .
mark millar , the build manager for diy sos described it at the time as a `` powerful '' community response .
the work includes an extension and extra space on the ground floor .
the programme airs tonight at 21:00 on bbc one .
you know it took this many people to get matthew home , but they did it in 10 days .
i am so proud to be part of the whole thing , every one of them are superstars .
telford , where 's my hat ?
hat off .
i love you telford , well done ! ''

documents.title: in pictures : a cooler day but the sun is still shining for some
text: thanks to bbc weather watchers foggy and balgreen di for sending us these lovely of how it 's looking in ludlow and shrewsbury this morning .
it will be cooler today than of late , with the chance of a shower .
temperatures will peak at 22c ( 72f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: £ 13,000 haul in whitchurch jewellery shop raid
text: thieves made off with £ 13,500 worth of jewellery in a raid at a whitchurch family business , bosses revealed today
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: mum forced to give birth at home as midwife delayed amid maternity unit closures
text: health campaigners claim a ludlow mum was forced to give birth at home without a midwife present because the town 's maternity unit was closed .
kay smith was being told on a daily basis whether a midwife would be on duty , but when she went into labour the midwife had n't arrived and mrs smith was helped by paramedics .
both oswestry and ludlow midwife-led units will be closed until the second week in july .
bridgnorth will be closed for five days from tomorrow .
unlike paramedics , the midwife , who was in the ludlow area , took over an hour to reach mrs smith , by which time she had given birth .
the shrewsbury and telford hospitals nhs trust has apologised and said the midwife was delayed by roadworks .
it said that even if ludlow 's maternity-led unit had been open , the process would have been the same .
kay did not want a home birth .
she wanted to give birth at ludlow maternity unit .
she did n't do that because the maternity [ unit ] like bridgnorth , like oswestry , they keep closing and closing and closing . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police missed opportunity to confiscate gun
text: it 's emerged that police missed an opportunity to confiscate a shotgun , shortly before a telford sports coach used it to kill himself .
thirty-nine-year-old matt kendall , based in wolverhampton , shot himself on the long mynd two days after being arrested in bolton on sus of grooming .
officers realised he was a licensed gun holder , but a message between two police forces to confiscate the gun , did n't get through , according to the independent police complaints commission .
however , the ipcc said the message was just a precaution and a full risk assessment had `` not raise any concerns around increased risk of self-harm '' .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council crackdown on fly tipping and litter in telford
text: a new crackdown 's on the way against litter , fly-tipping and dog mess around telford .
there 's a plan for 40 council staff to get training and new powers , including issuing on-the-spot fines of between £ 80 and £ 400 .
councillor richard overton says it 's not about making money , but ridding the borough of unsightly rubbish .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a mild cloudy start , some brighter , sunny intervals later with things feeling fresher than of late and top temperatures of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on thursday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: request to remove suspect 's gun missed
text: request to remove suspect 's gun missed

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: ludlow firefighters to raise money for grenfell victims
text: fire crews from ludlow will be taking part in a charity car wash in aid of victims of the grenfell tower fire in london , as well as the fighters charity this weekend .
it will take place at ludlow food centre between 11:00 and 15:00 on sunday .

documents.title: matthew kendal suicide : opportunity missed to confiscate shotguns
text: police missed an opportunity to confiscate a shotgun shortly before a telford sports coach killed himself , the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) has found .
officers searched matthew kendall 's home in the west midlands shortly after he was released on bail as part of an investigation in bolton into alleged grooming .
however , a request by greater manchester police for colleagues in the west midlands to confiscate mr kendall 's legally held shotguns never made it to the officers on the ground , the ipcc said .
two days later he was found dead .
coroner john ellery today found mr kendall had shot himself and said officers involved were not to blame .

likewise , an ipcc investigation found the message to confiscate the guns was not due to individual failings , but `` due to communication processes and the volume of activity on the log at the relevant time '' .
it said the original request was `` precautionary only '' and a risk assessment `` did not raise any concerns around increased risk of self-harm '' .

documents.title: watch : west midlands weather forecast
text: the heatwave seems to be officially over .
find out what 's in store for the next few days .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: 'police not to blame for long mynd suicide '
text: shropshire 's coroner says police officers who were investigating a man accused of grooming , were n't to blame for his suicide .
an inquest today heard how matthew kendall , who is 39 and from wednesfield , shot himself near the top of lond mynd last october .
it was just days after being released on police bail ibn bolton following an alleged incident of grooming .
as a result of mr kendall 's death , an investigation was launched by the independent police complaints commission .
today , the coroner john ellery said none of the police forces involved - including west mercia - contributed to his death .

documents.title: specialist school improves after being rated inadequate
text: a specialist school near shrewsbury , which had been classed as inadequate , has been given a clean bill of health by inspectors .
cruckton hall school , which caters for pupils with autistim spectrum disorders , is now rated good by ofsted , which previously found serious failings in its education and social care .
today 's report says the management team have taken effective action to improve the school , creating an `` ambitious culture '' .
it also says teaching has got better , with some now of the `` highest quality '' .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: lucky to be alive : afc telford player suffers broken arm , leg , hip and knee in 60ft fall
text: an afc telford football player is lucky to be alive after falling 60ft through a building .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: request for blood donors in shropshire
text: people across shropshire are being asked to consider donating blood .
nhs blood and transplant say they need 200,000 new blood donors each year to make sure they have the blood they need .
they particularly want more young people to come forward , as well as black donors to help combat sickle cell disease .
last year nearly 5,000 people in shropshire gave blood .

documents.title: shrewsbury town face 'stronger league ' , says hurst
text: shrewsbury town boss paul hurst says the club will be battling in a `` stronger league '' when their new season starts in august .
former premier league sides blackburn and wigan join the division , having been relegated from the championship in may .
coming up from league two are 2008 fa cup winners portsmouth , along with plymouth and doncaster .
any team coming down from the championship now is going to have a really good chance of winning promotion back . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Shrewsbury Town summariser, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: farmers given encouragement over brexit subsidy concerns
text: farmers from around the country are in shropshire today for a conference , and brexit is on the agenda .
the arable event 2017 is happening at woodlands farm near weston park .

one of this afternoon 's keynote speakers is agricultural business consultant simon ward , who has compared the situation to new zealand , saying that fewer than 1 % of farmers went out of business when their subsidies were removed there .
fascinating to learn from simon ward that fewer than 1 % of nz farmers went out of business when their subsidies were removed !

documents.title: council approves shropshire leisure cuts
text: shropshire council 's cabinet has approved plans to cut funding for indoor leisure centres .
its strategy for 2018 to 2023 , will see funding for facilities including the severn centre in highley and shrewsbury 's roman road sports centre scrapped in 2019 .

places including church stretton leisure centre and whitchurch swimming centre will retain their funding for another six years , and seven of the county 's largest leisure facilities will be protected from the cuts .
lezley picton from shropshire council says the council has no plan to close leisure centres entirely , but needs to prioritise how money is spent .

documents.title: 'exciting ' plans for 8,000-seater stadium in oswestry
text: discussions have started to bring an 8,000-seater football and rugby stadium to oswestry .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: inquest hears of coach 's suicide following police investigation
text: a coroner 's court has heard how a telford martial arts coach shot himself in a car park in church stretton .
matthew kendall , 39 , who lived in wednesfield , was being investigated by the police following allegations of grooming .
the inquest at wellington civic centre heard how mr kendall drove to a car park at the top of the lond mynd in october last year .
a witness taking photographs nearby heard the gun shot , found mr kendall 's body , and called the emergency services .
shropshire 's coroner john ellery said mr kendall was on police bail following an alleged incident in the bolton area .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire maternity unit closures extended
text: women due to give birth at ludlow 's maternity unit say they 've now been told it 'll be closed until 11 july .
the centre , along with one in oswestry , were due to reopen today after being closed for a week .
the closures are down to staff sickness , meaning more people are needed at the main unit at telford 's princess royal hospital .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire likely to miss government mental health target for children
text: shropshire is likely to miss the government 's mental health target for children , according to the independent think tank localis .
the government has set a target of treating 35 % of 5 to 18-year-olds suffering a mental health condition , by 2020 .
but the think tank says that 's not achievable unless schools do more to tackle mental health .
chief executive , liam booth-smith , says otherwise there is a `` risk as a nation of failing an entire generation of vulnerable young people '' .

documents.title: farmer admits breach in after worker killed in shropshire barn electrocution
text: a farmer has admitted a health and safety breach after a worker was killed when he was electrocuted on the roof of a barn .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: emotional abuse to children up in west midlands
text: reports of children being emotionally abused increased by almost 60 % in the west midlands last year .
that 's according to new figures released by the nspcc , which says it received 1,017 calls in 2016-17 from people concerned about children , up from 641 calls in 2014-15 .
the charity fears the problem could be the tip of the iceberg and is urging the government to investigate .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: brexit a key discussion point at farming event
text: more than 1,000 farmers are gathering this morning to discuss how their industry might look after the uk leaves the european union .
the arable event 2017 is being held at woodlands farm near weston park .
it will also feature machinery demonstrations and showcase the latest in arable technology .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town 's fixtures announced
text: shrewsbury town will begin their season at home to northampton on 5 august .
league one 's fixture list then sends them away in three of the next four games , starting with a trip to wimbledon .
the town are away at wigan on boxing day , at home to oldham on new year 's day , and finish the season with the visit of mk dons on the 5 may .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: telford defender 'lucky to be alive ' after accident
text: telford united say one of their players is `` lucky to be alive '' after falling 60ft through a roof .
the club says defender jordan broome , who is part of the bucks ' academy , has broken both his legs , kneecaps , and pelvis .

documents.title: weather : yellow warning for flooding
text: today will be a sunny day for most of us but an unlucky few could see very different weather .
the met office is warning that some parts of the west midlands could face torrential downpours , frequent lightning and even a chance of hail from late on this afternoon .
areas affected could even be subject to sudden localised flooding affecting roads , homes and businesses .

documents.title: super-surgery bid put forward for shrewsbury
text: a multimillion-pound surgery could be built in shrewsbury after plans were submitted .
riverside medical practice - the largest in the town - has been searching for a number of years for land to move to from its cramped surgery in roushill .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: police on the hunt for whitchurch ring thieves
text: police are looking for two men after rings were stolen from a shop in whitchurch .
the pair are reported to have entered dodington 's jewellers on the town 's high street at around 16:15 last thursday .
west mercia police say they entered the store and asked about items , before grabbing a number of rings and leaving on foot .
the offenders are described as asian men , aged between 25 and 35 years old .

documents.title: ambulance service sees rise in heat-related call-outs
text: the west midlands ambulance service says it has seen an increase in heat-related call-outs of more than a third .
while some people are enjoying the high temperatures , the service says elderly , babies and young children are all more vulnerable .
they say on the 12 june they had almost 970 such calls , but on monday they had more than 1,340 .
the advice from doctors is to drink lots of water and stay out of the sun between 11:00 and 15:00 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: support centre launched for young entrepreneurs in shropshire
text: a new centre dedicated to helping the county 's young business people has been launched in oswestry .
shropshire youth support trust opened the youth enterprise centre at the british ironworks centre last night .
sir john timpson , who runs the timpson 's chain of keycutters and cobblers , was the guest of honour .
that 's our future , the businesses that will make the country in 50 years time have not been heard of , they are being invented now . ''

documents.title: cricket : shropshire hold on for a draw v herefordshire
text: shropshire just held on for a draw in their minor counties cricket match with herefordshire at whitchurch .
finishing on 226-9 , the team benefited from a stubborn innings from joe carrasco , who took them to the close at 55 not out , leaving the visitors stranded one wicket from victory .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man responsible for telford cannabis factory caught by fingerprints
text: a man whose fingerprints were found at a house where cannabis plants with a value of more than £ 140,000 were seized has been jailed for two years .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: more money to tackle homelessness in telford
text: telford and wrekin council has pledged to invest an extra £ 95,000 , on top of what it already spends , to tackle homelessness .
the additional cash will be spent on a number of schemes including extending a rough sleeping project to run all year round .
previously the service had only been funded during the three coldest months of the year .
these figures from the department of communities and local government show how the number of rough sleepers has gone up during the current decade .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: league one fixtures in full
text: league one fixtures in full

documents.title: council to look at plans to cut shropshire leisure centres
text: shropshire council 's cabinet is meeting today to consider proposals to cut funding for leisure centres .

the council 's indoor leisure facilities strategy could see money for shrewsbury 's roman road sports centre , along with facilities in shifnal , wem , much wenlock , highley and craven arms stopped by the end of 2019 .
sites in whitchurch , cleobury mortimer and church stretton leisure centre would lose their funding by the end of 2023 .
however , the council has also recommended that funding for seven of the county 's largest facilities will continue , including shrewsbury 's sports village .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: funding changes 'could make two-thirds of shropshire pupils worse off '
text: schools across the county are waiting to see if there 'll be any changes to education funding in today 's queen 's speech .
under plans to change the way money is allocated , two-thirds of the county 's primary pupils are expected to lose out .
head teachers say they 've already made cuts and are relying on fundraising to pay for printing and furniture .
we do n't think it 's right for shropshire it 's very tough to look forward because we do n't know what the national funding formula is going to be in the final analysis . ''
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : today 's forecast in 52 seconds
text: after several days of this heatwave , it looks like today could be the last for the moment - here 's how the west midlands is looking for wednesday .
plus you can keep yourself updated on the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning and welcome to shropshire 's local live page
text: welcome to live updates from the bbc shropshire newsroom this morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us or contact us via facebook .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tribute to schoolgirl killed in crash
text: tribute to schoolgirl killed in crash

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: tributes paid to girl killed in shrewsbury car crash
text: friends of a girl knocked over and killed by a car in shrewsbury last week have created a memorial area for her at school .
olivia reeves , aged 11 , died after the crash last thursday on mytton oak road .
her headteacher at st george 's primary school , sharon munro , says she was a `` passionate and spirited '' individual .
she 's appealed for the family 's privacy to be respected .
a 77-year-old man has been released under investigation .
he 's suspected of drink-driving and causing olivia 's death by dangerous driving .

documents.title: telford athlete rio mitcham tipped for the top
text: the coach of the telford athlete rio mitcham says his attitude is the reason for his success .
the 17-year-old has run half a second off linford christie 's british 100m record this season .
he was forced to pull up with an injury while leading the 100m at the english nationals over the weekend .
eric cartwright says rio is one of his best ever athletes .
rio has been absolutely outstanding .
if i ask him to modify something in the way he runs , next time he goes it 's there .
he listens , he performs , everything i ask him to do he does .
he 's a delight to coach .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : the west midlands forecast for tonight
text: it 's been another warm and sunny afternoon with highs of 27c ( 82f ) and the night wo n't be an awful lot cooler .
expect lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: copper and brass flowers planted for charity
text: volunteers have planted 700 copper and brass forget-me-not flowers in the walled garden at attingham park near shrewsbury to raise funds for severn hos
the charity says a similar project last year with handmade iron flowers raised £ 91,000 .
the forget-me-nots symbolize love and memories and we wanted to create a beautiful keepsake for people to treasure and to hold dear . ''

documents.title: help is at hand for budding young entrepreneurs
text: a new enterprise centre opens near oswestry today to help young entrepreneurs start up new businesses .
the shropshire youth support trust set up a similar centre in telford 18 months ago .
this hub is at the british ironworks centre , offering discounted rent and professional support for 18 to 30-year-olds .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: advice on how to stay safe and well in the hot weather
text: it 's going to be another scorcher across shropshire today and here 's some timely advice on how to stay safe in the sun .
beat the heat .
advice on how to stay safe & well in hot weather .

documents.title: man jailed for running red light and crashing into lorry on shropshire crossroads
text: a man who drove through red lights into the path of a lorry injuring himself and his passengers has been jailed .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather : yellow warning of rain for wednesday
text: after the hot weather we 've been having it looks like we 're in for some heavy downpours tomorrow .
we could even see lightning and there 's a chance of hail .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: new guidebook to the long mynd launched today
text: a new national trust guidebook to the long mynd is published today .
it 's been put together by the shropshire-based photographer and nature writer , andrew fusek peters .
the trust claims the volume , called upland , is the first ever guidebook to the long mynd .
a launch and signing event takes place at the carding mill valley tea rooms at 18:00 this evening .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more volunteers needed to help vulnerable adults live with a family
text: a scheme run by telford and wrekin council to help vulnerable adults is hoping to recruit more carers .
shared lives places adults , who need help to live independently , with a carer who welcomes them into their home and helps them develop skills to live independently .
currently there are 104 vulnerable adults who are shared lives carers across the borough of telford & wrekin .
if you want to do something worthwhile , rewarding and get paid for it , then you should consider becoming a shared lives carer .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: thunderstorms , hail and heavy downpours on the way as shropshire heatwave to come to an end
text: shropshire 's mini-heatwave is set to come to an abrupt end on wednesday with torrential rain , thunderstorms and hail .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: woman who lured shrewsbury man into terror plot 'dangerous and violent '
text: a woman who lured a man from shrewsbury into a terror plot in northern ireland has been jailed for 16 years .
christine connor , 31 , lured stuart downes by posing online as a swedish model .
in fact , she was a lone-wolf republican dissident .
she admitted planning to kill police officers , and throwing homemade grenades at them in belfast four years ago .
she was arrested together with downes and charged , but downes killed himself in woodland off the a5 last year .
you are dangerous and committed to a violent philosophy to achieve political objectives .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: in shropshire bathed in glorious sunshine
text: pretty much all of shropshire is bathed in glorious sunshine this afternoon .
thanks to bbc weather watchers nick nick for sending this lovely of flowers in bloom in cleobury mortimer and peter steggles for the of longnor looking lush and green .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: useful information for people attending michael ball and alfie boe 's concert
text: here 's some useful information if you 're planning on going to the michael ball and alfie boe concert tonight at walcott hall .
it 's an outdoor concert and is seated .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'lone wolf republican ' jailed for 16 years
text: 'lone wolf republican ' jailed for 16 years

documents.title: jacob , 24 , dies two years after horror fall off billionaire 's boat
text: a much loved engineer has died , two years after suffering brain damage in a fall from a yacht owned by a billionaire friend of chelsea supremo roman abramovich .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: swimming in disused quarries is dangerous , say police
text: officers from the broseley and much wenlock safer neighbourhood team have been called out to shadwell quarry , in much wenlock , twice in as many days following reports of a group of people in the area .
they emphasised the dangers of swimming in disused quarries and highlighted some of the risks such as the shock of the cold water and debris that may be lurking just before the surface .
officers are in liaison with the owners of the quarry to see what more can be done to secure the site and prevent people trespassing .
only yesterday officers were called out to a group of youngsters seen swimming in the rover severn at bridgnorth .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hot weather warning issued
text: hot weather forecasts have prompted public health england to issue advice to beat the heat .
its amber warning is declared when there is a 90 % probability of a heatwave .
children and the elderly are being warned to keep cool and hydrated .
here 's the met office with more
we 're proud to support # coverupmate , encouraging outdoor workers to enjoy the sun safely to avoid uv damage and reduce risk of skin cancer
uv levels are high for many this week , get the uv forecast on our app - ios : or android :
or move to nw highlands of scotland !
@ twitterid # nationalsunglassesday

documents.title: head teacher cuts services to avoid large classes
text: a shropshire head teacher says he 's had to make more than 20 cuts to services in his school or face big class sizes .
steve morris runs mount pleasant primary near shrewsbury and is trying to balance his budget for next year .
he says extra pressure and more pupils means funding 's being reduced year-on-year .
we 've got 38 or 39 children , potentially , in classes next year .
that 's the scary thing for me , knowing that , that it 's certainly not an environment that 's conducive to learning .
we 've had to put in a whole range of measures , over 20 types of cuts unfortunately .
which mean that we can keep those class sizes manageable .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your another hot and sunny day
text: the fields across shropshire are looking very dry after the recent hot weather and it 's going to be hot again today .
here 's how it 's looking in tibberton near newport .
thanks also to bbc weather watcher , shropshire lass for this lovely of ludlow bathed in sunshine .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cricket : shropshire v hereforshire - day three
text: runs continued to flow on day two of shropshire 's match with herefordshire at whitchurch yesterday .
in reply to the herefordshire 's first innings total of 392 , shropshire posted 367 all out .
leading by 25 runs after the first innings , herefordshire ended the day on 226 for 2 , a lead of 251 runs .
play at whitchurch resumes at 11:00 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: singers bring show to shropshire
text: the singers michael ball and alfie boe are performing an open-air concert at shropshire 's walcot hall tonight .
the concert starts at 17:00 .
it 's a big week for the venue as cliff richard is on stage there on wednesday night .

documents.title: investment for shrewsbury 's railway station
text: a total of £ 7.5 million will be spent on shrewsbury train station over the next year to bring it up to date .
the town 's conservative mp daniel kawczynski says network rail will spend the money and the station will become `` state-of-the-art '' .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live
